CalculateNettingPosition(IEnumerable<IPositionValues>)

Calculates netting (average) position from specified collection of positions

public static AggregatedPosition CalculateNettingPosition(this IEnumerable<IPositionValues> r)

Parameters

r IEnumerable<IPositionValues>

Returns

AggregatedPosition

Remarks

Input positions must be of the same instrument, otherwise calculation does not make sense

CanMoveStopLossForward(Position, double)

Returns true if specified newStopLoss is ahead of the current StopLoss If position has no stop loss at all, it always returns true For flat positions (Flat) this method always returns false

public static bool CanMoveStopLossForward(this Position position, double newStopLoss)

Parameters

position Position
newStopLoss double

Returns

bool

Examples

For Long position, with stop loss = 100: if new stop loss = 101, the method returns true, if new stop loss = 99, the method returns false

GenerateExitByMarketOrderParameters(Position, string?, InitiatorType, string?)

GetDistanceToPrice(Position, double)

returns a distance between price and position price AveragePrice according to market position (MarketPosition) For long positions (Buy) the distance is price minus AveragePrice For short positions (Sell) the distance is AveragePrice minus price For flat positions (Flat) the result distance is always NaN

public static double GetDistanceToPrice(this Position position, double price)

Parameters

position Position
price double

Returns

double

Examples

Long position at 100, specified price 101: delta = 1 Short position at 100, specified price 101: delta = -1

GetFirstOrder(Position, bool, bool)

Returns the first order of the specified position GetFirstOrderId(Position, bool, bool)

public static Order? GetFirstOrder(this Position position, bool firstByTime = false, bool skipEmptyOrderIds = true)

Parameters

position Position
firstByTime bool

If true then all orders will be preliminary sorted by time and then the first will be used

skipEmptyOrderIds bool

If true then all executions without specified OrderId will be skipped

Returns

Order

Remarks

If the only thing you need from result order is its id (OrderId) then use GetFirstOrderId(Position, bool, bool) because it works faster

GetFirstOrderId(Position, bool, bool)

Returns the first order of the specified position GetPositionExecutions(Position)

public static string? GetFirstOrderId(this Position position, bool firstByTime = false, bool skipEmptyOrderIds = true)

IsPriceAhead(Position, double)

Checks if the specified price is ahead of AveragePrice For long positions (Buy) it means price is higher than position price, for short positions - lower

public static bool IsPriceAhead(this Position position, double price)

Parameters

position Position
price double

Returns

bool

True if specified price is ahead of position price

Examples

Long position at 100: price 101 is ahead, price 099 is behind Short position at 100: price 101 is behind, price 099 is ahead

IsPriceBehind(Position, double)

Checks if the specified price is behind of AveragePrice For long positions (Buy) it means price is lower than position price, for short positions - higher

public static bool IsPriceBehind(this Position position, double price)

Parameters

position Position
price double

Returns

bool

True if specified price is behind of position price

Examples

Long position at 100: price 101 is ahead, price 099 is behind Short position at 100: price 101 is behind, price 099 is ahead

IsSameKey(Position, Position?)

Returns true if passed instrument has the same UniqueKey as current instrument has

public static bool IsSameKey(this Position me, Position? other)

Parameters

me Position
other Position

Returns

bool

Remarks

Attention! This method does not compare all parameters of the instrument. It checks UniqueKey only To compare the instrument thoroughly, use ParametersEqual(Position)

IsShort(IPositionValues)

Returns true if position is short

public static bool IsShort(this IPositionValues position)

Parameters

Returns

bool

MoveAveragePriceBack(Position, double)

Shifts AveragePrice opposite to the direction (MarketPosition) for specified delta If the specified position is flat (Flat) the method returns NaN

public static double MoveAveragePriceBack(this Position position, double delta)

Parameters

position Position
delta double

The value to shift the price

Returns

double

Examples

For long position (Buy) with average price (AveragePrice) = 100, shifting back for 10 gives the result 90 For short position (Buy) with average price (AveragePrice) = 100, shifting back for 10 gives the result 110

MoveAveragePriceForward(Position, double)

Shifts AveragePrice along the direction (MarketPosition) for specified delta If the specified position is flat (Flat) the method returns NaN

public static double MoveAveragePriceForward(this Position position, double delta)

Parameters

position Position
delta double

The value to shift the price

Returns

double

Examples

For long position (Buy) with average price (AveragePrice) = 100, shifting forward for 10 gives the result 110 For short position (Buy) with average price (AveragePrice) = 100, shifting forward for 10 gives the result 90
